text:
After a few minutes of working, apache freezes and then shutdown, error_log 
contains this lines:
[Thu May 05 15:09:55 2005] [notice] Apache configured -- resuming normal 
operations
[Thu May 05 15:09:59 2005] [alert] (11)Resource temporarily unavailable: setuid: 
unable to change to uid: 81
[Thu May 05 15:09:59 2005] [alert] Child 14346 returned a Fatal error... Apache 
is exiting!
[Thu May 05 15:09:59 2005] [emerg] (22)Invalid argument: couldn't grab the 
accept mutex
[Thu May 05 15:10:10 2005] [emerg] (22)Invalid argument: couldn't grab the 
accept mutex
[Thu May 05 15:10:10 2005] [emerg] (22)Invalid argument: couldn't grab the 
accept mutex
[Thu May 05 15:10:10 2005] [emerg] (22)Invalid argument: couldn't grab the 
accept mutex
creator: mc@paycash.ru

text:
This error:

[Thu May 05 15:09:59 2005] [alert] (11)Resource temporarily unavailable: setuid: 
unable to change to uid: 81

means you had a process limit set when starting httpd (via ulimit -u or so on).
 You should remove the ulimit to prevent this happening.  (the limit is not
enforced as root, only when the child tries to become a less-privileged user
using setuid)
creator: jorton@redhat.com
